title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

00:17 <jvelociter> yw

09:41 <jstoldt> has joined #xwiki  
09:41 <jstoldt> hi  
09:41 <jstoldt> is it just me and my IBM powered proxies or is xwiki.org down?  
09:43 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:44 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:45 <+jvdrean> jstoldt: it seems the datacenter xwiki.org is in has network issues  
09:46 <jstoldt> ah, okay. at least i will be able to access it at some point again. that's more comforting then having network admins blocking pages due to high traffic or something  
09:54 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:58 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:58 <vmassol> cjdelisle: good morning. I'd like to move your dropPermissions in contentview.vm so that it's after the title computation  
09:58 <vmassol> as otherwise it fails if the title requires some rights to execute  
09:59 <@cjdelisle> That's ok since changing the title causes contentAuthor to change.  
09:59 <vmassol> ok doing it  
09:59 <@cjdelisle> I will make a note to add to the security page that title is considered part of "document content".  
10:01 <@cjdelisle> I love that dropPermissions() line. Everything after that line pretty much doesn't need to be reviewed for security :D  
10:01 <vmassol> well I hope it's correct  
10:01 <vmassol> I see some renderText() call for displaying footnotes for ex  
10:01 <@cjdelisle> How so?  
10:01 <vmassol> I hope that we don't need the author to be set for that somehow  
10:02 <vmassol> I mean we need to be sure we don't need the user to be active for the rest  
10:02 <vmassol> like the bug we introduced for the title  
10:02 <@cjdelisle> It doesn't actually change the author IIRC it just makes PR go away and makes \*AsAuthor do as if author was guest.  
10:03 <vmassol> it's not just PR  
10:03 <vmassol> you say in the javadoc that the user is considered as XWiki Guest  
10:03 <vmassol> is that not correct?  
10:03 <vmassol> \* Drop all author permissions by switching author to guest.  
10:04 <@cjdelisle> No, thinking about it I don't think it is. Let me check again.  
10:05 <vmassol> so for ex if an api requires admin rights it'll work after dropPermissions?  
10:06 <@cjdelisle> Indeed I need to reword that.  
10:07 <@cjdelisle> hasProgrammingRights() will always return false, getDocumentAsAuthor, saveAsAuthor and deleteAsAuthor will act as if the author was guest.  
10:07 <@cjdelisle> That is all.  
10:09 <@cjdelisle> Indeed that comment is plain wrong. I think it was a case of "refactored the code, left the comment the same".  
10:12 <vmassol> ok  
10:12 <@cjdelisle> Changing that right now before I forget.  
10:13 <+sburjan> good morning everyone from the platform :)  
10:13 <vmassol> I'd ceate a jira issue if I could....  
10:13 <vmassol> but infra is down :(  
10:15 <+sburjan> vmassol, cjdelisle .. I confirm a pretty important flaw .. Enygma`  discovered it. I can add a non-existing user to a group  
10:16 <vmassol> hehe  
10:21 <vmassol> hmm where do we get to know all valid "viewer" param values for templates?  
10:23 <@cjdelisle> IIRC ?viewer= just gets a vm by the name of the viewer.  
10:23 <@cjdelisle> It's in view.vm  
10:23 <vmassol> not the values  
10:24 <vmassol> I know some: attachments, comments, changes, code  
10:24 <vmassol> but I can't be sure to be exhaustive  
10:24 <vmassol> we don't have a spec nor doc about it  
10:24 <vmassol> and there's no template naming conventions  
10:24 <@cjdelisle> hehe  
10:24 <@cjdelisle> <-- doesn't like templates.  
10:25 <@cjdelisle> By their design, they \_want\_ to turn into spaghetty code.  
10:25 <vmassol> I also can't change templates too much or I'll break anyone having custom skins....  
10:25 <vmassol> they're "APIs"  
10:27 <@cjdelisle> in view.vm IIRC there's a line like: #if($request.viewer) #parse("${request.viewer}view.vm") #end  
10:27 <vmassol> yes  
10:27 <vmassol> except it's:  
10:27 <vmassol> #template("${viewer}.vm")  
10:27 <@cjdelisle> hehe  
10:28 <@cjdelisle> ls /templates <-- that's the list.  
10:28 <vmassol> what it means is that it's not bound and new one can be invented by users  
10:28 <vmassol> which makes it even wore  
10:28 <vmassol> worse  
10:28 <vmassol> for refactoring  
10:28 <@cjdelisle> ?viewer=view fun fun  
10:28 <ralucaM> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <vmassol> yeah  
10:29 <@cjdelisle> re templates hate cleanlyness by their design.  
10:29 <vmassol> right now I want to put common template code for all viewer templates  
10:30 <vmassol> basically 90% of the code in contentview.vm should be shared by all viewers  
10:30 <vmassol> title handling, rendererdContent computation  
10:30 <vmassol> shortucts displaying  
10:30 <vmassol> also calling docextra.vm should be in contentview.vm  
10:31 <vmassol> contentivew.vm should be called content.vm or better they should all be called ${viewer}view.vm or even better view${viewer}.vm  
10:31 <vmassol> hard to change  
10:31 <vmassol> all I can think of right now is introducing yet another vm.....  
10:31 <vmassol> this is probably why we have so many vm files btw ....  
10:32 <@cjdelisle> API sprawl. It's a ratchet.  
10:43 <+sburjan> @devs : any idea when these  will be fixed ? http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Test/30snapshots I can't distinguish the tests that fail because of these with the tests that fail because of Se2b1 ... I'm kinda stuck here  
10:47 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <+sburjan> vmassol: as a optimization : In the UserProfileTest I see we have various fixtures. EditProfileTest creates a TestUser for testing, the others use Admin Profile. Should we use all the tests on TestUser ?  
10:47 <+sburjan> and delete it in the teardown ?  
10:48 <+sburjan> it's  a more consistent approach  
10:51 <sdumitriu> has quit  
10:51 <jvdrean> has quit  
10:51 <+sburjan> XE-755  
10:51 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
10:52 <+sburjan> interesting  
10:52 <+sburjan> but how come bot isn't down .. AFAIK it's hosted on xwiki.org  
10:53 <@cjdelisle> heh  
10:53 <@cjdelisle> !search test  
10:53 <+sburjan> can you explain this ? :)  
10:54 <@cjdelisle> yup  
10:54 <+sburjan> amaize me  
10:55 <@cjdelisle> xwiki.org is fine.  
10:55 <@cjdelisle> It is behind a reverse proxy.  
10:55 <+sburjan> for me it's not working  
10:55 <@cjdelisle> The proxy is dead.  
10:55 <+sburjan> well I'm not going through any proxy  
10:56 <+sburjan> maybe some DNS issue ?  
10:56 <vmassol> sburjan: why delete in teardown and not create it in setup instead?  
10:56 <@cjdelisle> reverse proxy. It's to protect xwiki from the big bad internet.  
10:56 <vmassol> (haven't fully followed what you mentioned though - I'd need to re-read the test code for that)  
10:56 <+sburjan> vmassol: @Before I create the TestUser, @Before i delete Test User  
10:57 <@cjdelisle> The reverse proxy is what shows us skol when xwiki behind it is dead.  
10:57 <+sburjan> vmassol: @Before I create the TestUser, @After i delete Test User  
10:57 <vmassol> no need to delete  
10:57 <vmassol> it's unnecessary cost  
10:57 <+sburjan> it's a dummy user, why do you want to keep it ?  
10:57 <vmassol> because it'es faster  
10:57 <vmassol> and you can give it a unique name  
10:57 <vmassol> if you don't want a clash  
10:57 <+sburjan> we already have this : getDriver().get(getUtil().getURLToLoginAsAdmin());  
10:57 <+sburjan>             getUtil().deletePage("XWiki", TEST\_USERNAME);  
10:57 <+sburjan> okay  
10:58 <vmassol> like name it after the test class  
10:58 <+sburjan> yepp.. will do  
10:58 <+sburjan> thanks  
10:58 <@cjdelisle> A test is responsable for setting up the system before it runs. It's not responsable for cleaning up it's garbage.  
10:58 <vmassol> yep  
10:58 <+sburjan> well.. why do we have @After then ?  
10:59 <@cjdelisle> Sometimes it's really needed. Imagine connections to a database or something where the system will fail if you don't clean them up.  
10:59 <+sburjan> yeah...  
11:00 <+sburjan> so I guess we won't need a ultra cleanup .. we just have to make sure it won't mess with the other tests  
11:00 <+sburjan> so a little bit of garbage for order to get some speed :P  
11:00 <@cjdelisle> No. You make the other tests so that it can't mess with them.  
11:02 <vmassol> sburjan: @After is for unit tests  
11:02 <vmassol> junit is for unit tests  
11:02 <vmassol> we're using for functional tests, it doesn't mean we have to use all its features....  
11:02 <vmassol> and yes sometimes @After is needed  
11:03 <@cjdelisle> Yea to null all the variables since junit doesn't drop the old tests :/  
11:03 <vmassol> actually for functional tests we should almost only have a single scenario that runs everything in sequence  
11:03 <vmassol> functional test = scenario chaining tests, unit tests = independent tests that can be exeucted in any order  
11:03 <+sburjan> like a predefined flow ?  
11:04 <vmassol> yes although we don't go to that extreme  
11:04 <vmassol> since we still want to be able to execute only some functional tests  
11:04 <vmassol> (and not all)  
11:04 <vmassol> I was just mentioning this so that you understand the spirit  
11:05 <+sburjan> yepp.. thanks  
11:05 <+sburjan> I'm always interested in learning the bet practices  
11:05 <+sburjan> I'm still trying to create the proper fixture :P  
11:05 <+sburjan> more exactly trying to find  out the best name for the fixture method  
11:06 <vmassol> setUp  
11:06 <vmassol> :)  
11:06 <+sburjan> great :D  
11:11 <+sburjan> I'll also try to remove the try - catch - finally block from UserProfileTests  
11:13 <+sburjan> question : teardown is ran after each test or at the end of all tests from class ?  
11:13 <vmassol> eahc test  
11:14 <vmassol> @AfterClass is each test class  
11:14 <vmassol> it's not tearDown sburjan, it's @After  
11:14 <+sburjan> yes, @After  
11:14 <vmassol> see @After vs @AfterClass in the junit doc  
11:14 <+sburjan> thanks  
11:31 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
11:48 <mflorea> has quit  
11:51 <@cjdelisle> Deleted attachments have generated ids :/  
11:52 <@cjdelisle> I can generate ids by taking the id of the attachment, shifting 4 bits and XORing with the date.  
11:52 <@cjdelisle> \*4 bytes.  
11:53 <@cjdelisle> So a collision would require 2 attachments with the low 32 bits colliding which are deleted in the same millisecond.  
11:54 <@cjdelisle> Or develop a an id incrementing module which I really don't have time to do right.  
11:54 <Menso> has joined #xwiki  
11:57 <@cjdelisle> Oh attachment id is an int. deletedAttachment id collision --> attachmentId collision.  
12:01 <sabageru> has joined #xwiki  
12:03 <@cjdelisle> Found a bug which will probably never be exposed, should I commit a fix against the original jira id or wait until jira is back up and open an issue?  
12:03 <@cjdelisle> vmassol? ^  
12:05 <@cjdelisle> we'll never see it so long as <generator class="native" /> means sequencial.  
12:06 <vmassol> cjdelisle: if a jira issue has been closed and the version released it shouldn't be comitted against  
12:07 <vmassol> (I don't know if it's the case for this one)  
12:07 <@cjdelisle> It is. Should that rule be adhered to strictly in all cases?  
12:07 <vmassol> IMO yes  
12:07 <@cjdelisle> Ok then I will always do that from now on.  
12:50 <jstoldt> hmmm i wanted to attach 87 files... apparently i missed one... any idea what would be the best way to check which file i missed?

15:20 <jstoldt> i really should RTFM some times ;)  
15:21 <jstoldt> hmmm i think the jira mail server is offline... or it is sending with a larger delay now...  
15:37 <+sburjan> did anyone figured out what is causing our snapshots to : This configuration cannot be displayed because it was last edited by Admin who doesn't have permission to edit this page. on several XAADMINISTRATION ?  
15:41 <jstoldt> i'll be out for today  
15:41 <jstoldt> see you :)  
15:41 <jstoldt> has quit  
15:46 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I'd like to add a new vm file called by contentview.vm and all viewer vms that will do: 1) compute the content display 2) call titlevars.vm 3) display title 4) call shortcuts.vm  
15:47 <vmassol> ideally we would refactor view.vm to put common things there but I'm worried that we might break custom skins  
15:47 <vmassol> wdyt?  
15:47 <@sdumitriu> +1 for the idea  
15:47 <vmassol> note that 1), 2), 3), 4) is what is currently done in contentview  
15:47 <@sdumitriu> I'll look at the exact commit to comment on it  
15:47 <vmassol> that I would put in its own vm to reuse it from the other viewer vms  
15:47 <vmassol> ok  
15:48 <vmassol> sdumitriu: and I'm going to remove the XHMTL escape in titlevars.vm

17:32 <vmassol> but I don't know

17:32 <vmassol> let's say within 2-3 weeks IMO if I have to make a guess

17:33 <npm> thanks
